comment: He is a funny dude and his lectures were easy to follow, but the multiple choice tests were brutal. All notes are posted on D2L, so if you're willing to teach yourself, you don't have to show up for every class. The only reason why I got a B instead of a C or D was because of some survey he gave us for extra credit that gave everyone bonus points.

Easy class. His lectures expand on what's covered in the readings and make the material a lot easier to understand. Make sure you pay attention to the notes in the online labs since a lot of the test questions come from there. Don't be intimidated to ask him for help, he's always willing to help students before/after class if you have questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Webb is a great and funny older guy, but he is not a great professor at all. The class is extremely lecture heavy and the tests are super hard as you are not sure what to study since he doesnt give any hints or study guides. I am usually a straight A student but he caused me to get my first ever C. Would not take again, save yourself.

DO NOT TAKE. The only optimistic thing I can say for him is that he is extremely knowledgable. He does not know how to dumb down the concepts for college students at all. His lectures are very hard to get into, his tests are extremely detailed, and God help you if you have to take a make-up exam. I BARELY passed this class. I REPEAT: DO. NOT. TAKE.

Dr. Webb is a great guy, but he is a little tough and I don't think he even means to be. Did not use textbook at all. Homework online. 4 tests last one is cumulative. Lecture will put u to sleep so most ppl don't go bc its all online, but I went anyway bc he's a nice guy. Tests are tough. If you actually TRY and study u will get a good grade.

Professor Webb's lectures weren't bad, and he's a really nice guy, but he made worded his tests in a way that made sure we couldn't do well. He taught the material well, but come test day his wording was so difficult that I couldn't perform well on the test. I'm a straight-A student and struggling to make a B or a low A.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Exams are super difficult. I would study the material for hours and get C's on every one.

4 tests with the last one counting as the final. Online homework due the night before the test and those are all your grades. Lectures are okay, you can tell he cares about the topic. He posts the power points online, so I rarely went to class and I am making A's and B's on everything. If you're a good student I recommend.

He's hilarious without even trying to be; coming to class always made me laugh. The tests are bit tough compared to how laid back he is, but reading his powerpoints and concentrating on the homework problems is important. Recommend going to class every now and then but every day is not necessary.

His class his hard. You have to put work in. He's a great  guy and can relate to almost anything he teaches. Reading chapters in the textbook will help you. His tests are indeed hard, but reviewing his powerpoints and reading the textbook is your best chance. His online homework is important because that could decide whether you get an A or a B.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. He is the worst professor I've ever taken. I thought that maybe I could get through his class since I'm not a slacker, but I was so wrong. He maybe kind of a nice person, but his tests are EXTREMELY HARD and only use concepts. I study for days and sometimes weeks before his tests, and I still get bad grades. DON'T DO IT!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Horace Webb is a good guy, but not the best professor. His final is by far the hardest final I have taken. It is over everything you have learned. It is not an easy class, and his tests are very specific.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He gets off topic very quickly, thinks that because he understands it that everyone should understand it just as easily. Doesn't really offer any help for those struggling in  the class and asks very specific questions on tests.

Horace is honestly one of the worst professors I've ever had. If you are looking to pass this class do not take him. He lectures every day and usually gets off topic within 5 minutes. The only thing counted toward your grade are tests and offers no extra credit or any help whatsoever. You will not get an A in this class, it's not humanly possible.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: No study guides or extra credit! only  3 heavy tests & final, along with online homework that you can't even go back to use as a review. Your grade really depends on your test grades! Since there isn't a study guide you are left with so much material & don't even know what to study! I studied for hours & still failed tests. DONT TAKE.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This professor does not teach. He goes over powerpoints he already made and then goes over them TERRIBLY. He gets off track and stays off track. He would tell us information that didn't pertain to anything we were currently learning about, so everyone started not going to class cause there was no reason to. 4 hard tests define your grade. DON'T.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Excellent professor. Smart lecturer worth attending class for material on test. Lectures are extremely helpful in understanding and absorbing material for A's on tests. I seriously enjoyed meeting this professor and glad he is one of my college memories - he inspires students to care about the environment. I very highly recommend Professor Webb.

Professor Webb was a good guy. His tests were tough and were graded out of 135 points instead of the usual 100 so that made things a little more difficult for me. You have to really study to get a good grade. He's very friendly so asking for help or just talking to him is not a problem.
worst teacher ever you guys don't take him.

This class was the hardest class i have taken in my four years at Kennesaw. The test come straight from the book chapters , however the questions he ask are very specific. I would never take a class with this teacher again

His tests are really hard!!!. Even you study hard, his tests are always harder. I studied twice as much and barley passed the class. No extra credit. Three tests, lengthy homework, and a cumulative final. Don't take him if you have another option.

EXTRA CREDIT! but he doesn't mention it at all. Plenty of opportunity to gain extra points. (36 point online quiz, and mastering) You are dumb if you don't make an A. I only showed up on test days and made an A on every test and in the class. USE YOUR RESOURCES! (power points, quizlet, friends)

Professor Webb is a really nice guy, but his test are extremely hard. He expects you to know the most specific details from the chapters in the book. ONe good thing about his class is going or not going will really not make a difference he does not take attendance and every thing you are tested on is from your book not his lectures .

He is the sweetest old man, but his tests are tough!! I studied and tried hard, but still couldn't get above a C. You can skip because everything is online but I don't recommend it. Even when I studied hard, there was a ton of material I didn't recognize from lecture or pp. For a gen ed class, it was tough. I wouldn't recommend.

His tests are EXTREMELY difficult. I would attend every class, actively take notes, read the powerpoints and textbook chapter and still do poorly. He gives you broad information in class and then the tests are just impossible!! I really struggled in this class and all you have are 4 tests & hw for your grade. Wouldn't take him again.

These tests are incredibly detailed and difficult for a GEN ED class.  Also, he doesn't let you exempt anything like some of the other science 1102 teachers do.  An A is definitely attainable in this course, it just takes an excessive amount of studying to do it.  Good news is, his lectures follows powerpoints that he posts, so no attendance needed

I didn't think Webb was as bad as the people below are saying. Some of his jokes are pretty lame, but he's a nice guy. The tests aren't the easiest I've ever taken but they definitely aren't THAT difficult. If you read the chapters and take notes this class shouldn't be hard. Other than test days I went to lecture twice and ended up getting a B.

I am an A student, just got my 1st F. Had to make appointments to get grades. Gives cheesy, lame analogies. He is a tool and is intent on tricking students. Just give me the information, let me learn it and reproduce it on the d@mn test. Typical college students worse nightmare. Do not take this prik if you are a normal, sane, person.

Great teacher, over all.  Lectures are Powerpoint lectures made up of condensed material from the text, peppered with personal stories and clarifications.  Tests are somewhat difficult, but all from the material with no surprises.  If you read the assigned material and study a little for each test, you will get an A.

Unclear on how to prepare for exam. The exams are long difficult and focused around labs that are done at home. He is not the nicest or sweetest professor I've met. His lectures are NOTHING like the test. No study guides. He is extremely tough grader I failed his class. Please take a better professor.

Webb is an awesome guy.  Teaches the material well.  Show up to class, listen, do the homework, study a bit and its an easy A or B.  Funny jokes.  I wish I had gotten to know him more. Really is a great teacher and is there for his students.

He posts all the powerpoints for you to view, I've only gone to class on test days and still pass very easily (you just have to take the time to look at the powerpoints and study). There's online work and 4 tests. He's a good teacher to take if you're just trying to breeze through your gen ed classes.

Ok I am an A student and  no matter how much I studied I only pulled off a C. His tests are SO hard and are so different then the material that is covered. You have to be very good at critical thinking and applying terms to do well in the class. He knows his stuff and is a great teacher I just think the tests were unnecessarily difficult.

He is so specific that you just have to study a lot and hope that you happen to remember random unimportant details. all answers to labs are on quizlet so that's easy. But unless you overthink every detail you probably won't get an A. You don't have to go to class because he puts all ppts online. Funny but I would rather get an a sooo yeah.

Its a pretty easy class to take. If you read over the labs and power points you will be fine. He does get a little off topic during his lectures but he is a very interesting guy to listen to when he is talking. I would recommend taking him.

You will need to study the power points and labs to receive a good grade on the tests. Also, do all the homework because it is helpful. The classes were a pain to sit through some days, but he is passionate about environmental science which makes it kind of interesting to pay attention.

Worst professor i have ever come in contact with at Kennesaw. All he does is read off the power point and then gives impossible tests that have nothing to do with the power points. I studied so hard and barely get d's on the tests. I do not recommend this professor if you are not extremely knowledgeable about environmental science upfront.

attendance is not necessary, but he does  put emphasis on  what you should study . his lectures are long but his test are pretty straight forward, and really upfront on what he is asking. if you regularly attend lectures, he's willing to go over old tests and help review the material you don't understand. has a sense of humor and loves his job

He's a fairly good lecturer and loves his material, so if you enjoy science too, take him, you'll love it.  He's a nice guy, pretty funny.  However (and this could just be because i am bad at science), his tests are very difficult and require lots of studying for even a B.  I couldn't even tell you how to get an A.  Good teacher, not an easy grade.
Frequently goes off topic on rants, especially about birds and his cars. Test materials come from about five different sources, be prepared to do a lot of work outside of class.

Attendance is not mandatory at all, you can skip all you want and doesn't effect your grade. the class is laid back, but the teacher is so unclear and lectures are long. he usally goes off on rabbit trails. Tests are very hard and long. What he teaches in class is completely irrelevant to what is on the tests.

Dr. Webb's class is easy, but if you only go to the lectures that won't be enough. Be prepared to read the book, and study a lot. The tests are sort of hard, everything is multiple choice though. The labs are all online, and you only have to read through the basic information to pass the lab questions. Not hard, but not easy. PS: He LOVES birds.

Nice guy but his lectures are pretty useless, so attendance is not mandatory to pass. All notes are on power points, and the book helps. The material for this class is very easy however his wording on the test makes them a lot harder than it needs to be. Questions about the labs are on the tests which can be annoying.

This class was one of the easiest I have ever taken. I only went to class on review and test days and simply copied down the powerpoint and didn't even look at the labs. I have gotten B's on both the tests by studying the night before. Easiest class ever. He's a really cute old man too.
